p: The C6/36 cells infected by Wolbachia wAlbB strain and uninfected cells generated by removing the bacterium through tetracycline treatment [ 35] were cultured at 28 °C in medium consisting of equal volumes of Mitsuhashi/Maramorosh (Bioconcept, Switzerland) and Schneider’s insect medium (Sigma, France), supplemented with 10% ( v/v) of heat-inactivated fetal bovine serum (PAA, USA) and penicillin/streptomycin (50 U/50 μg/mL; Gibco, Invitrogen, France). Cells were continuously passaged in 25-cm 2 flasks by scrapping and seeding a new flask with 1:5 of the cell suspension in 5 mL of fresh medium, every 4 days. The Chikungunya virus (CHIKV) 06.21 strain was isolated in C6/36 from newborn serum sample with neonatal encephalopathy during the outbreak in La Reunion Island [ 6]. Viral stocks were produced on C6/36 cells in 25-cm 2 flasks, at Multiplicity Of Infection (MOI) of 0.01. After 3 days at 28 °C, supernatants from infected cells were recovered and virus titration was done using plaque assay on Vero E6 (green monkey kidney) cells [ 40]. The titer stock virus was estimated to 10 8 plaque-forming units (PFU)/mL and stored in aliquots at −80 °C until used.
